thread.title: Govt withdraws draft of 'encryption policy'
thread.title_full: Govt withdraws draft of 'encryption policy' - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Govt withdraws draft of 'encryption policy'
text:
NEW DELHI: Telecom minister Ravi Shankar Prasad announced on Tuesday that the government has decided to withdraw the draft of "encryption policy". 

The telecom minister said that the draft of encryption policy has raised many apprehensions. 

"In view of the concerns raised over the encryption policy, I have asked the draft to be withdrawn and rewritten it," Prasad said.

The minister also clarified that it is just a draft and not a policy of the government. 

Prasad, said, that no ordinary consumer would be affected by the encryption policy. 

However, we have to acknowledge that cyberspace transactions are rising enormously and the government need a new policy to make them safer. 

Prasad also said that the Union government supports the freedom of social media. 

"We are very proud of the initiatives taken by the government under leadership of PM Narendra Modi for promotion of social media," the telecom minister said.
